Description: Hematite weight for steelyard with bronze suspension-ring; ovoid shape weight with flattened top and bottom; one of the sides has also been smoothed in the centre; crescent-shaped ring attached to the stone by two small piercings at one end.
Curator's comments: See L. Åström, SCE IV/1D, pp. 545 and 605-606. This example represents the highest unit of the Cypriot weight system of the LBA; however, Yon has noted an example of this type as late as the 7th-6th centuries BC at Idalion (cited by Chavane, 'Salamine de Chypre VO. Les petits objects' (1975), p. 44.
